note.p: Birth: Rothley Temple, Leicestershire, England (25 October 1800)
Death: Holly Lodge, Campden Hill, Kensington, London (28 December 1859)
Burial: Poet's Corner (at the foot of Addison's statue), Westminster Abbey, London

Career: Fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge (1824); called to the Bar (1826); Commissioner in Bankruptcy (1828); MP for Calne, Wiltshire (1830); MP for Leeds (1831); Member, Supreme Council of India (1834-1838); President of the Commission for composing a criminal code for India (1835); returned to England (1838); began writing a 'History of England' (1839); MP for Edinburgh (1839-1847); Secretary of War (1839-1841); died of heart failure
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1860-1862 vol 11 pp xi-xxvi
Notes: Elected a Fellow before becoming Baron.
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 1. 1731-1847' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 307-332
